recital.text: The Stockbridge-Munsee Community is a federally recognized Indian tribe with inherent sovereign powers and is governed by the Stockbridge-Munsee Tribal Council pursuant to the 1937 Constitution, as amended;
The Stockbridge-Munsee Tribal Council has the authority under its Constitution and its inherent rights as a sovereign nation to adopt and amend Ordinances;
The Tribal Council established general rules of civil procedure for its court system under Chapter 5, Civil Procedure, in tribal law;
The Tribal Council wishes to now establish a separate ordinance addressing procedure before the Stockbridge-Munsee Court of Appeals; and

The present Chapter 5 needs to be modified in order to replace references to appellate procedure with cross reference to the new Chapter 5-A, Appellate Procedure ordinance and deleting language addressing appellate procedure.

the Stockbridge-Munsee Tribal Council hereby approves changes to Chapter 5 that amend Section 5.2 (A)(3) to add a cross-reference to Chapter 5-A and delete Section 5.22, which previously addressed appellate procedure.

para.text: To establish a set of procedural rules to govern civil litigation in the Tribal Court System, except to the extent the Court of Appeals has its own procedural rules applying to appeals before it as established under Chapter TCT.02; and

para.heading: Commencement of Appeal.
para.text: An appeal is commenced by filing a Notice of Appeal within 45 days of the entry of a judgment. An appellant shall serve the Notice of Appeal on the Respondent pursuant to Section TCT.02.04(c)(7).

para.heading: Briefing.
para.text: The Appellant shall file a written brief, not to exceed 20 pages in length, within 30 days of the commencement of an appeal. The Respondent shall file a written response brief, not to exceed 25 pages in length, within 30 days of receiving the Appellant's brief. The Appellant may file a written reply brief, not to exceed 5 pages in length, within 15 days of receiving the Respondent's brief.

para.heading: Oral Argument.
para.text: If the Court of Appeals deems that oral argument is necessary, the Court of Appeals shall schedule such oral argument within 30 days of the filing of the last brief filed in an appeal.

para.heading: Decision.
para.text: The Court of Appeals shall issue a written decision either affirming, in whole or in part, or reversing, in whole or in part, the decision of the Trial Court. The Court of Appeals may also issue a written decision to remand the case to the Trial Court for further proceedings. The Court of Appeals shall issue all written decisions within 60 days after the conclusion of the oral argument, if any, or the expiration of time to file a response brief or reply brief, whichever is later. The Clerk of Court shall enter and mail or deliver a copy of the entered decision to the parties within 3 days of entry.

para.heading: Post Judgment Motions for Relief.
para.text: A party shall file a motion for relief from a decision within 10 days of entry of the decision or the motion will be barred.
